results.content:
It is very-very-very basic... 

Every section starts with the instructor creating html and css files, etc... Every time he literally types out(!) all the boilerplate tags (html, body) - no cutting and pasting! And commenting in this way: "now I hit the enter and type this... and now I type this"
I watched the whole course a 2x speed and even then I often fast forwarded 15 sec all the time.
And did I say the content is very basic?

There was tiny-tiny bits of information that I thought was useful - hence 2 stars, not 1. For example, his explanation on how to clear floats and a few other bits.

Anyway it was a free course, so I wouldn't complain much.

Maybe next time the instructor can provide better content.

results.content: Overall the course met my expectations.  It covered the advertised topics.  Would have much preferred more in-depth discussion/examples of different media queries instead of spending half the class typing in the essentially the same html structure 3-4 times.
results.content_html: Overall the course met my expectations. It covered the advertised topics. Would have much preferred more in-depth discussion/examples of different media queries instead of spending half the class typing in the essentially the same html structure 3-4 times.

results.content: Maybe I just expected something completely different. But anyway, talking about responsive and just making the CSS fixings relative isn't responsive. Later you show morely how it's working, but just throwing buzzwords around without showing the real meaning is just half the work.

results.content: No DRY, always repeating html step, cuted end of lessons and so on... i doubt a code is validable (especially css part) without errors. Maybe I was expected too much, I realy wanted to learn more about different sorts of layouts and how to create them...
